briefTitle: Belatacept Therapy for the Failing Renal Allograft
officialTitle: Belatacept Therapy for the Failing Renal Allograft
summary: The purpose of this study is to test the safety and effectiveness of belatacept (NulojixÂ®) in preventing antibody formation in patients with chronic failing kidney transplants. This study is a randomized study of first-time kidney transplant patients who have worsening kidney function and biopsy proven grade 2 or 3 interstitial fibrosis/tubular atrophy (IF/TA). Patients must be eligible to get a second transplant. They must have completed or be actively undergoing evaluation for re-listing for a second transplant. Patients will be randomized to either convert to belatacept or continue on calcineurin inhibitor-based therapy.

primaryOutcome.measure: Number of Participants With Donor-specific Antibody Formation
